metadata.synopsis: A few years after the Balkan wars, President Bill Clinton plans to visit to the town of Tesanj, Bosnia-Herzegovina, to observe the country's progress. Hearing the news, alcoholic former police chief Faruk (Enis Beslagic) hatches a wacky plan to avenge the wartime death of his son. As the town's corrupt cops and mobsters work to cover up their crimes and present the United States with a sanitized and harmonious version of Tesanj, Faruk schemes to kidnap Clinton and hold him for ransom.

reviews: This is an engaging, enjoyable film. The acting is utterly convincing and the plot so tight you could bounce things on it.
There have been so many war movies recently. Fuse is a peace movie. It is a film that allows viewers to visualize peace.
Fuse is a clever political drama that shows how difficult it is for a small town to reinvent itself over a seven day period.
Featured in the New Directors/New Films series, this droll, soulful comedy-drama tells us that after the smoke clears, life goes on.
